Module com.arobertson.software_ii__c195
Package arobertson.C195.Utilities

Class InputLoader

java.lang.Object
arobertson.C195.Utilities.InputLoader
public class InputLoader extends Object
Utility class responsible for loading data into various input controls (ComboBoxes, DatePickers).

  • Method Details

    • loadContacts

      public void loadContacts(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> contactInput) throws SQLException
      Loads all contacts from the database into the provided ComboBox. The contact information is displayed in the format "ContactID - ContactName".
      Parameters:
      contactInput - The ComboBox to populate with contact data.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • loadTimes

      public void loadTimes(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> startTimeInput, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> endTimeInput)
      Loads a list of available appointment times into the provided start and end time ComboBoxes. The times are generated based on the business hours of 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM Eastern Time (EST), converted to the user's local time zone, and presented in 30-minute intervals. The time display is formatted as "h:mm a" (e.g., "8:00 AM").
      Parameters:
      startTimeInput - The ComboBox to populate with available start times.
      endTimeInput - The ComboBox to populate with available end times.

    • loadCustomers

      public void loadCustomers(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> customerIdInput) throws SQLException
      Loads all contacts from the database into the provided ComboBox for customer selection. The contact information is displayed in the format "ContactID - ContactName". Note: This method currently uses ContactDAO and displays contact information, which might be unintended if customer names are expected. Consider reviewing the data source.
      Parameters:
      customerIdInput - The ComboBox to populate with customer identifiers.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • loadUsers

      public void loadUsers(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> userIdInput) throws SQLException
      Loads all users from the database into the provided ComboBox. The user information is displayed in the format "UserID - Username". LAMBDA #1 - Using a lambda expression here makes the code more succinct and easier to read compared to a traditional loop. It clearly expresses the intent: for each user, add their formatted ID and username to the ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      userIdInput - The ComboBox to populate with user data.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • loadCountries

      public void loadCountries(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> countryInput) throws SQLException
      Loads all countries from the database into the provided ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      countryInput - The ComboBox to populate with country names.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • loadStates

      public void loadStates(String countryInput, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> stateInput) throws SQLException
      Loads the divisions (states/provinces) associated with the selected country into the provided ComboBox. If no country is selected (countryInput is null), the state ComboBox will be cleared. This lambda expression efficiently iterates through the divisions and adds their names to the ComboBox. Without it,a for-each loop would be necessary.
      Parameters:
      countryInput - The currently selected country name.
      stateInput - The ComboBox to populate with state/province names.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • diableWeekends

      public void diableWeekends(javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDateInput, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDateInput)
      Disables selection of weekend days (Saturday and Sunday) in the provided DatePicker controls. This is achieved by setting a custom day cell factory for both the start and end date pickers.
      Parameters:
      startDateInput - The DatePicker for the start date.
      endDateInput - The DatePicker for the end date.

    • loadMonths

      public void loadMonths(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> monthSelector)
      Loads a list of month names into the provided ComboBox. The months are listed in chronological order, starting with January. The "January" is set as the default selected value.
      Parameters:
      monthSelector - The ComboBox to populate with month names.
